column2: As  it  has  been  clearly analyzed  by  the  Learned High Court Judge, (Pg.23  of his
High  Court Judgement),  I see  no  reason  for  a child to  tell  lies  before a court to
make  false  allegations against his or her own  mother who gave birth  to  him/her.

column1: It is  highly  unlike  that  a  child  would  falsely  implicate  his  own  mother  for  the

column2: murder of his  own  father  at the  age  of 10  years  and  reiterate  the  same  position
considered, there appears to be no lack of credibility on the part of the witness.
